intro: Fagara mollis, commonly known as the sweet-scented evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Fagara mollis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its pleasant aroma. It thrives in shaded to partially sunny environments and requires well-drained, moist soil for optimal growth.
